column2: Earlier, I urged the PM to withhold part of the £39 billion divorce bill until we get a comprehensive free trade agreement. If the EU is serious about agreeing a good deal, they should be happy to oblige.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CBS3yo-vkVE …
This Brexit deal is a capitulation - pass it and our party will sleepwalk into electoral defeat, @DavidDavisMP blogshttp://huffp.st/Ah4jQ83

Earlier today we launched a report on the practical solutions to the Irish border and customs issues. We can avoid giving up our sovereignty, our constitutional integrity and our ambition for global trade. https://globalbritain.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Global_Britain_Fact_not_Friction.pdf …

This deal is not what the people voted for. It will tie us to the Customs Union for years to come with no way out. But there is still time to negotiate a Canada+++ deal that delivers on the referendum. So let’s get on with it.https://www.conservativehome.com/platform/2018/11/david-davis-there-has-long-been-an-alternative-to-this-discredited-draft-deal-its-the-canada-style-plan-that-tusk-and-barnier-offered-us.html …

Earlier I had useful discussions at the US Department of Agriculture. An amazing building, built in the Great Depression. It’s the 3rd largest government building, put up in a hurry on plans based on Leavenworth prison. Very long corridors, you can walk on a 2.3 mile round trip!pic.twitter.com/8YXISZN7qR
We have to have a Canada+++ deal to allow us to have a free trade deal with America

I have spent the last few days in Washington talking to US Government Trade and Treasury officials encouraging a free trade deal with the UK. Excellent response. They have already started on the procedures to allow negotiations to start immediately once we leave the EU in March.

“There’s a big majority against this policy in the House of Commons. I’ve been putting up the alternative as persuasively as I can. I’ve persuaded a large part of the Conservative Party and others, and we’ll put that back to the EU” @DavidDavisMP
#StandUp4Brexitpic.twitter.com/yPVraFDPba

Pleased the Government has changed its position on FOBTs. This is a wholly sensible decision and I congratulate @Tracey_Crouch for her principled stance.https://twitter.com/tracey_crouch/status/1062707071987138561 …

Cabinet Ministers must recognise their responsibility and think very carefully about the decisions they make today. This deal would be a betrayal of the referendum result and have irreversible consequences for years to come.http://blogs.spectator.co.uk/2018/11/why-the-cabinet-must-reject-theresa-mays-brexit-deal/ …

.@Tracey_Crouch was right to take a stand over Fixed Odds Betting Terminals. The Government must not prevaricate any longer on reducing the maximum stake. That is why I am supporting amendments to make it happen sooner rather than later.

This is the moment of truth. This is the fork in the road. Do we pursue a future as an independent nation or accept EU domination, imprisonment in the customs union and 2nd class status. Cabinet and all Conservative MPs should stand up, be counted and say no to this capitulation.

Pleased that the Government has made the sensible decision to agree to release the legal advice on the backstop. I called for this in The Sunday Times earlier this month. Done at the appropriate time, it will allow for a sensible decision without undermining the negotiations.

100 years ago today Canadian Forces liberated the city of Mons. It was great to see a strong Canadian representation at commemorative services held across the weekend. Today is a day to reflect on the immense sacrifices made for our freedom. #LestWeForget.pic.twitter.com/wFE1z17Pjn
Yesterday I also met the granddaughter of George Ellison, the last British soldier to die in WW1. Lovely lady.
This followed a wonderful address by the Governor General of Canada, @GGJuliePayette.
Today I am at Saint-Symphorien Cemetery in Belgium, after a Canadian/British/German Remembrance Service. #LestWeForgetpic.twitter.com/p1if9p9CJ6
It was a pleasure to speak with @christopherhope on this week's @brexitbroadcast.https://twitter.com/brexitbroadcast/status/1060788448804720640 …

Sorry to see @JoJohnsonUK resign. He's right that the Government's current proposals are "a travesty of Brexit" and represent a huge democratic deficit - out of Europe but run by Europe. However, a 2nd referendum is not the way forward and is not supported by the public.

If reports are true regarding concessions on fishing and a border in the Irish Sea, then this is not the Brexit that people voted for. If the EU will not negotiate in good faith then we must assume that WTO is still better than what looks like a bad deal.

The Cabinet and Parliament must be able to make a fully informed decision on any future relationship with the EU. Earlier, on @BBCr4today, I reiterated the need for the Government to release the full legal advice provided by the Attorney General.http://youtu.be/E81Z8b0tB58

Releasing the Cabinet's legal advice on Chequers is politically, ethically and practically the right thing to do, and the only course that allows Parliament to make an informed decision. We must learn from history and avoid repeating Blair's mistakes.https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/david-davis-downing-street-must-publish-the-dodgy-backstop-dossier-or-bedamned-like-tony-blair-qqxxwzvzv …
Deeply saddened to hear of Jeremy Heywood's passing. He served this country with the utmost professionalism and dedication. My thoughts are with his family and friends.
I am pleased to pledge my support to @CareafterCombat. An excellent charity helping veterans make the successful transition from military to civilian life.pic.twitter.com/fqiBUTiAHy
Sad to hear about @tracey_crouch and sorry to lose the best sports minister of modern times.

As I said earlier, a Conservative Budget should aim to deliver on the aspirations of the British people. The right approach to welfare, education and housing are key to this. We must deliver true social mobility and exemplify the real values of capitalism.http://youtu.be/USwygQQFgqU

For the avoidance of doubt I believe the PM will get a deal with the EU but anything based on the Chequers plan or one that keeps us in the Customs Union will not pass the Commons. Time to revert to free trade deal suggested by EU?

We're delighted to announce that @DavidDavisMP has pledged to #StandUp4Brexit 

Thank you so much for you support, David, and for continuing to push for the Brexit that the British people voted for.

#ChuckChequers #BinTheBackstoppic.twitter.com/FoRop3xFDA

The @BBC wants to cut free TV licenses for over-75s, who have an average weekly income of £363, whilst simultaneously paying performers up to £1,750,000 a year. 
A fifth of over-75s are below the poverty line. The BBC should look elsewhere to save money - I can think of one place

This is a brilliant piece by @Mark_J_Harper in today's Telegraph. 

Infrastructure, such as ANPR cameras, exists at dozens of locations throughout Northern Ireland. The Irish border issue is eminently solvable with existing technology and infrastructure.https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/10/09/time-destroy-myth-cant-have-free-trade-brexit-irish-border/ …

This morning I wrote to my Conservative colleagues to underline the fact that there are alternatives to the Chequers proposal. A Canada+++ free trade deal is good for the UK and negotiable with Brussels.pic.twitter.com/72AzFsWzsA

From the very beginning, the EU offer has been a Canada+++ deal. Much further-reaching on trade, internal security and foreign policy cooperation. This is a true measure of respect. And this offer remains in place. #brexit
"Pretty much the whole British establishment didn't like Brexit" says @DavidDavisMP #GMBpic.twitter.com/3hrwDlnbrh

ERG Vice Chair Mark Francois on @BBCWorldatOne: "If push really comes to shove, and they try and push Chequers through the House of Commons, then I and my colleagues will vote against it,"pic.twitter.com/CClbOOrxqh
Great to have @GregHands on board; a very sensible and level-headed former Trade Minister.https://twitter.com/GregHands/status/1044173334055981056 …

.@DavidDavisMP: “The biggest losers from #Chequers would be the new businesses: the AI, the genetics businesses. due to the clumsy and protectionist regulation which often comes from the EU” #PlanAPlus
"We need to reset the negotiations," says @DavidDavisMP at the @iealondon alternative Brexit plan launch.pic.twitter.com/o9o2msM1Jz

Earlier today I, along with several colleagues, presented a proper, practical and sensible solution on how the Irish border can work post-Brexit. 

Now is the time to think about workable alternatives to Chequers. http://bit.ly/2x16lTh

.@DavidDavisMP: "I am joining the @LeaveMnsLeave rally in Bolton as a matter of principle - to ensure Brexit is delivered and democracy upheld."https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/09/06/michel-barnier-says-chequers-deadas-david-davis-join-forces/ …
'@DavidDavisMP "The Chequers proposal is actually almost worse than being in...it leaves us in a position where [the EU] dictate our future rules without us having a say."pic.twitter.com/bupvOGwsKc

PM @Theresa_May and Brexit Secretary @DavidDavisMP today signed commemorative copies of the EU (Withdrawal) Act for each of the ministers who worked on this crucial piece of Brexit legislation.pic.twitter.com/mPJ3X9TnKR

Congratulations to @theresa_may who worked hard to lobby China on lifting the ban on beef exports from the UK, when we visited in Jan and my thanks to DIT officials for putting so much effort into making this happen. Estimated to be worth £250 million over the next five yearspic.twitter.com/kIkmtemWhk

After more than 250 hours of debate in Parliament, the EU (Withdrawal) Bill has become law – a landmark moment in our preparations to leave the #EU.https://twitter.com/DExEUgov/status/1011614686406742027 …
[2/2] This is a decisive step forward in delivering our exit from the EU and I'm grateful to all those who have been involved in delivering this essential piece of legislation #roadtobrexit
[1/2] After over 250 hours of debate, the EU (Withdrawal) Bill has completed its passage through Parliament
Secretary of State @DavidDavisMP stresses importance of co-operation on #Galileopic.twitter.com/9SMXnr3nVD

Pleased to see @guyverhofstadt in London this evening – we discussed the good progress that has been made since March and our shared, ongoing commitment to getting a deal that works for both the UK and the EU.pic.twitter.com/RuZshen1M1

Today we have published a joint statement on progress in the Brexit negotiations, ahead of the European Council next week. There remains work to be done but we are taking important steps forward. https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/joint-statement-on-withdrawal-agreement-19-june-2018 … #roadtobrexit

Excellent news that @SiemensMobility in Goole have secured a £1.5bn order for 94 new London Underground trains with the potential for over 200 more to come. This brings 700 highly skilled jobs to Yorkshire and will create a major industry in the area for many years to come.
The UK has a unique starting position with the EU. Minister @SuellaBraverman  talks about third country statuspic.twitter.com/WWFIip3mPR

If you want to catch up on my speech today covering our future security partnership, you can read the full transcript here  https://www.gov.uk/government/news/david-davis-speech-on-the-future-security-partnership …https://twitter.com/DExEUgov/status/1004396202681622528 …

The #UK's unwavering commitment to European security means we should be able to continue to fully participate in #Galileo now and in the future.

 https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/technical-note-on-uks-participation-in-galileo …pic.twitter.com/7xWixmekkr

I very much welcome #Hungary's support for the UK remaining a part of #Galileo.

A pleasure to meet with #Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó today.pic.twitter.com/fLs74hMuAK
Our citizens depend on this, let’s not let them down.
A relationship based solely on existing third country precedents, as some seem to be suggesting, would lead to a substantial and avoidable reduction in our shared security capability.
As I travel around Member States I hear how much our partners value the UK commitment to the EU’s security.
Today we set out more detail on how we think the UK, as a third country, can continue to cooperate with the EU on security and keep our people safe and prosperous.
" I will talk you through some of the highlights” @adamfleming on the EU and UK powerpoint slides being used in a Brexit battle #bbcdppic.twitter.com/BiyKECCtnv

Great to see a Red Arrows Hawk jet in Downing Street to mark the 100th anniversary of the @RoyalAirForce. Sadly it’s just a replica! But a great reflection on the brilliant aircraft made for many years in my constituency at Brough. #RAF100pic.twitter.com/dqR2OJcKgT

.@DavidDavisMP, Karen Bradley @NIOgov, and @GregClarkMP have been speaking to representatives from freight, cross-border businesses and the community in Northern Ireland as part of their work developing the max fac customs optionpic.twitter.com/1ElVrbOvSq

Secretary of State, @DavidDavisMP met the German Interior Minister Horst Seehofer in #Berlin today for a constructive meeting. Future co-operation is vital to protect the security of all our citizens.pic.twitter.com/KD0fS7F3UN

Great to be in #Berlin for a day of productive meetings.  Including with German Interior Minister Horst Seehofer, leader of the Free Democratic Party, @c_lindner, and Her Majesty's Ambassador to #Germany @SebWoodFCOpic.twitter.com/RAFM5LzVY1
The historic #EUWithdrawalBill finished its Third Reading in the @UKHouseofLords today after over 160 hours of scrutiny - double the amount of time spent in the @HouseofCommons

Pleased to meet Mayor of Antwerp @Bart_DeWever & @SanderLoones today to discuss shared priorities in the Brexit negotiations. Important for both sides that we protect jobs by keeping trade as frictionless as possible.pic.twitter.com/i0JzXFPemH
In the face of adversity we stand shoulder to shoulder with our closest friends and allies in France & the EU as we address the threats that face us.
Good to see @JY_LeDrian in London today – I expressed my condolences to those affected by this weekend's abhorrent attack in Parispic.twitter.com/VWFX8DPpG7
Delighted to meet with #Liechtenstein's Foreign Minister Aurelia Frick this week to discuss strengthening and deepening the excellent relations between our two countriespic.twitter.com/WjZccQandT

The security of our continent is too important to get wrong. Read our proposals for the UK EU security partnership here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/framework-for-the-uk-eu-security-partnership … #roadtobrexit

Agree w/ @MichelBarnier on need to move quickly in discussions + importance of a workable backstop. Our solutions must respect the EU single market and the integrity of the UK. We've put forward proposals on the future and look forward to making progress this week #brexit

Good overview of the approach we are taking to the EU Withdrawal Bill from my colleague @LordCallanan in @theHouse_mag . We are addressing the concerns of Parliament, while ensuring a smooth and orderly Brexit. Read it here: https://www.politicshome.com/news/uk/foreign-affairs/brexit/house/house-magazine/94703/lord-callanan-%E2%80%9Cwe-need-lift-our-eyes … #roadtobrexit

Today I started what promises to be a busy week in Northern Ireland. As we leave the EU it's essential both the UK and EU do what it takes to keep the border, which I saw this morning, free from physical infrastructure. We are determined to get this agreed by October.pic.twitter.com/W4zSuRSGRG
Useful discussion with Cyprus' Foreign Minister, Nikos Christodoulidis about our shared priorities for the future, including through the Brexit negotiations.pic.twitter.com/Q4TR2g9yZq

Pleased to see Malta's Prime Minister @JosephMuscat_JM again this afternoon while he is in London for #CHOGM2018 – our countries' strong bonds will continue long after Brexitpic.twitter.com/sr4tt5l3Jm
Secretary of State @DavidDavisMP took part in a @WSJ Q&A this morning, watch him explain the benefits of third country trade deals #RoadtoBrexitpic.twitter.com/YqE0govkqs

Pleased that we are investing £7.75m in @HumberNHSFT, providing 13 additional child and adolescent mental health beds across the local area. Local parents raised concerns about the provision of beds, so this latest announcement is therefore greatly welcomed.

I had the pleasure of meeting the Dutch Foreign Affairs Minister @ministerBlok today to discuss the #UK's exit from the #EU. We want to secure a deal that works for both our countries.pic.twitter.com/VkT5IkKh3m

Met with @DavidDavisMP at @DExEUgov this afternoon to continue pressing Government for a deal that will ensure the continuing success of the West Midlands, particularly in terms of our exporters and growth sectors with specific requirements in terms of overseas staff.pic.twitter.com/7ptafyIKt0
Earlier today I met @andy4wm to discuss how we ensure Brexit works for all parts of the UK. Hugely  impressed with all he’s achieved so far.pic.twitter.com/DlgwJxbxxZ

Pleased that EU leaders have welcomed agreement on the Implementation Period. Much progress on #Brexit made this week. I’ll be on @MarrShow this weekend to talk about the details and what’s left to do. #RoadtoBrexit

The deal we have struck today, on top of that agreed in December, should give us confidence that a good deal for the United Kingdom and the European Union is closer than ever beforepic.twitter.com/OJG3ulFFc6

Today Secretary of State, @DavidDavisMP spoke about our agreement on an implementation period with the #EU.

You can read his full statement here  https://www.gov.uk/government/news/david-davis-statement-eu-uk-article-50-negotiations-brussels-monday-19-march-2018 …pic.twitter.com/I7pg6RktsS
In her Mansion House speech, Prime Minister @Theresa_May made it clear that #CitizensRights will remain a priority throughout the negotiationspic.twitter.com/bNasYgBMzl

Busy day meeting with European ministers.

In #Denmark I met Foreign Minister Anders Samuelsen.

Then on to #CzechRepublic where I saw FM @stropnickym and PM @AndrejBabis to discuss the strong security partnership between our countries.pic.twitter.com/10jPYvXZwU
Another busy week of travel to #Malta, #Bulgaria, #Croatia and #Romania for productive meetings around progressing our exit from the #EU.pic.twitter.com/SYohzd1Dun

This morning, analysis confirms that the devolved administrations will be receiving extensive new powers as we depart the EU: http://gov.uk/government/news/uk-government-publishes-analysis-on-returning-eu-powers …pic.twitter.com/jLNdzI1d07

Constructive meeting with @guyverhofstadt before Cabinet this morning to discuss progress in the negotiations, and particularly his message about the rights of citizens across Europe.pic.twitter.com/ksg4PKjZUg
Productive meetings in #Croatia today discussing our relationship after the #UK leaves the #EU.https://twitter.com/DExEUgov/status/970710236674904064 …
#ICYMI Last week, Prime Minister @Theresa_May, set out the #UK's vision for a fair and open trade agreement with #EU. #RoadtoBrexithttps://twitter.com/i/moments/970615417986314242 …

Great to hear @Siemens are planning a new £200 million train manufacturing site in East Yorkshire. This will provide vital skilled engineering jobs in the local area and will support economic growth across Yorkshire as a whole. #SiemensGoole
Strong, detailed and well argued speech by the PM. Outlines a positive and coherent vision of UK-EU relations post #Brexit. Much work to do but looking forward to getting on with it #roadtobrexit

Looking forward to @theresa_may setting out our vision for the future economic partnership with the EU tomorrow. Negotiations are at a crucial stage and this will be a positive step forward on the #roadtobrexitpic.twitter.com/2vJscfAhBI
Good to catch up with Timo Soini and @sampoterho yesterday in #Finland
Productive meeting in #Stockholm this morning with @AnnLinde, we discussed #UK-#Sweden relations and how we work together after the UK leaves the #EU.pic.twitter.com/9tDXyYrp2p
Travel schedule continues: I’ve been travelling around Europe visiting our friends in Finland and Sweden. The snow has followed me here from the #UKpic.twitter.com/lrDVjCuxff

The Conservatives will use the opportunities of Brexit to lead a race to the top on regulations, workers' rights and wages. Labour would make that impossible by throwing away control:http://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/02/25/supporting-customs-union-labour-ripping-manifesto/ …

My Telegraph article today explains how Labour's latest Brexit policy breaks their manifesto promises to voters. No new ability to strike trade deals, no control over trade remedies:http://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/02/25/supporting-customs-union-labour-ripping-manifesto/ …

And my final European engagement this week was in sunny Lisbon. I met with Foreign Minister Santos Silva of @nestrangeiro_pt this afternoon to discuss opportunities for the future of the oldest diplomatic alliance in the world pic.twitter.com/V1X7YkSXDQ

A packed schedule today as I met with FM Katragoulas in Greece, and then Foreign Minister Szijjártó in Hungary for talks about our future relations beyond our EU exit.https://twitter.com/DExEUgov/status/966357615792934912 …
A busy and productive day in #Austria. Much discussion about our relationship once we leave the #EU. Nächster Halt: Athenpic.twitter.com/NsIuV3hinl

Reiterated the UK's absolute commitment to upholding the rights of Spanish citizens living in the UK, and vice versa, during latest constructive meeting with @AlfonsoDastisQhttps://twitter.com/DExEUgov/status/965628729019060224 …
Great game so far - despite the rain both sides showing their grit #ENGvWALpic.twitter.com/s6ZCwJK90h

Negotiations on implementation period proceeding well. #UK has made clear that we need safeguards to protect our interests. My team stand ready to negotiate across the board. Quick progress is essential.pic.twitter.com/ZhedqVoORn
Constructive talks today with @MichelBarnier in Downing Street. Our teams will work intensively to agree an implementation period by March.
A fantastic working day in #Luxembourg yesterday meeting ministers to discuss our implementation period, future trade agreements and future relationship.pic.twitter.com/1lvpQxOVTA
Looking forward to welcoming @MichelBarnier to London on Monday. Important next step in our work to build new partnership between UK & EU
.@DavidDavisMP sets out our vision on the Implementation Periodpic.twitter.com/OO3YXkQrSS
We are aiming to agree the principles of the Implementation Period at the March European Council, making good on our promise of providing certainty.pic.twitter.com/aPb5v3RVlF
As we prepare for talks on the Implementation Period we start from an incredibly strong position.
As @DavidDavisMP says: participating in a customs union should not preclude us from formally negotiating — or indeed signing — trade agreements
As @DavidDavisMP says; last year’s breakthrough in the negotiations was ‘a landmark moment of which we can be proud'
The aim of the implementation period is to provide certainty and continuity but it is also a bridge to a new future partnership…outside of the single market, and the customs union.
In the future the UK can take advantage of its status as an independent trading nation, forging its own way in the world
An Implementation Period allows us to grasp the benefits of Brexit by setting in place the fundamental building blocks for our country as we leave
Congratulations to @CottinghamCC getting funding from @AvivaUK Community Fund to increase female participation in #cricket. Excellent cause
The Withdrawal Bill passed through the @HouseofCommons yesterday. Watch @DavidDavisMP closing remarks.pic.twitter.com/xlxRin4GQX
Important approval for Withdrawal Bill. Thank you to all MPs who scrutinised: a better Bill goes to the Lords & Brexit is a step closer.
Watch @SteveBakerHW talk about the Withdrawal Bill as it enters the Report and Third Reading stages in the @HouseofCommonspic.twitter.com/aXXdE6iK7q
Great to get the @DExEUgov Ministerial team together today, welcoming our new Minister @SuellaFernandes . Much work ahead but we've got the team to deliver it.pic.twitter.com/DwyXwPJIMM
Good to meet with German business leaders yesterday, to discuss the UK-German business links & UK’s future economic partnership with the EUpic.twitter.com/y1d6CmEw0I
Great first day @dexeugov! Looking forward to the task ahead and working with top colleagues @DavidDavisMP, @SteveBakerHW, @LordCallanan & @WalkerWorcester

New figures show London was THE place in Europe to invest in tech last year. Our exceptional entrepreneurs and developers are leading the way:https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-britain-technology-venture-capital/london-was-top-destination-for-tech-funding-in-2017-pitchbook-idUKKBN1EU019 …
We’ve agreed protection for the rights of EU citizens and their families living in the UK https://eucitizensrights.campaign.gov.uk pic.twitter.com/meA3UmI5ks

Look past the thunder to come, we can make a success of the Brexit talks this year. My piece in today's @Telegraph on how we should trade togetherhttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/01/01/will-deliver-best-brexit-2018/ …
Welcome and good luck to the incoming Bulgarian Presidency of the @EUCouncil. Looking forward to working closely together over the coming months.
Today's roundtable with domestic think tanks was a great opportunity to discuss the progress we've made so far and the opportunities ahead.pic.twitter.com/yUxHY3vnwr
We have done what many said could not be done. Demonstrating what can be achieved with commitment and perseverance on both sides.pic.twitter.com/3sXZfvirXO

Today is a good day for Brexit and an important step for Britain. Thanks to hard work and determination, we have reached an important milestone and have achieved #sufficientprogress. There is still lots of work to come but we are ready for the next stage.
.@DavidDavisMP spoke to the House of Commons earlier today about the progress made in our negotiations for a deep and special partnership with the EUpic.twitter.com/l1wIwaGFEx

I look forward to working closely with the EP in the next phase, including on a top shared priority: ensuring admin procedures for citizens are as streamlined as possible in both the UK and EU. 2/2 
@guyverhofstadt
Pleasure, as ever, to speak to my friend @guyverhofstadt - we both agreed on the importance of the Joint Report. Let's work together to get it converted into legal text as soon as possible. 1/2
Citizens can now be confident about the rights they enjoy; we should now move forward to discuss our future relationship with the EU on issues like trade and security.

Today is a big step forward in delivering Brexit. Been a lot of work but glad the Commission have now recommended that sufficient progress has been reached. https://www.facebook.com/roadtobrexit/posts/343822852748598 …
In Estonia today, David Davis pledged the UK will remain the greatest ally of our European partners on security and defence after EU exit.pic.twitter.com/xmtxCFXrbw

Productive meeting with Marko Mihkelson, Chairman of Estonia’s Foreign Affairs Committee - we won’t be turning away from our friends and partners across the Continent after we leave the EU.pic.twitter.com/hry4oNMLR6
Fantastic to catch up with Estonian Europe Minister @MattiMaasikas. We spoke about how our commitment to contributing to European security and defence remains undiminished.pic.twitter.com/1mEOU1rwpj
Pleased to be reappointed SoS for Exiting the EU. Looking forward to getting on with job of negotiating a Brexit deal that works for all'
Arrived in Copenhagen for meeting with FM @anderssamuelsen – the UK's strong partnership with Denmark will thrive long after EU exit #dkpolpic.twitter.com/Touknfe8Lk
Happy St David's Day! Dydd Gŵyl Dewi Hapus! #StDavidsDaypic.twitter.com/70f5J2hVAc
Good meeting with Lithuanian PM Saulius Skvernelis. We can build a constructive new partnership after EU exitpic.twitter.com/i5supRfT2G
In Riga to meet PM @MarisKucinskis and others in Latvian govt, making clear it's in UK interest for EU to succeedpic.twitter.com/Z7EQpvfwAD
Good to meet @MattiMaasikas in Tallinn. We want a strong new partnership with EU and its member states after exitpic.twitter.com/CDHoXBBNRR
Delighted to be in Stockholm earlier to meet @AnnLinde ahead of talks on new UK-EU partnership after exit. Outcome can be good for bothpic.twitter.com/Qk9SG8Byyo
Writing in Sweden's @dagensindustri -determined to secure the rights of Swedes living in UK & Brits living in Swedenhttp://www.di.se/opinion/brexit-ministern-sverige-kan-lita-pa-oss-britter/ …
Good meeting with Finnish Foreign Minister Soini. Cooperation with European allies on security a shared interestpic.twitter.com/pwHqJanrwU
In Finland with Foreign Minister Soini - both clear we want a good deal for the UK and the EU @Ulkoministeriopic.twitter.com/k1hkNXlgFM
Good meeting with Latvian foreign minister @edgarsrinkevics and his team. Reaffirmed strong UK-Latvia relationspic.twitter.com/kMzM359Dcy
Our plan for a strong, new partnership with the EU: my statement to @HouseofCommonshttp://ow.ly/gmKh3085yFU
Good to meet financial services sector with @PHammondMP to discuss Brexit. Determined UK remains great place to invest and do businesspic.twitter.com/QFJjlI5ATn
Great visit to cutting edge @SPTS_Tech lab in Newport with @AlunCairns. Lots for UK to be confident about for futurepic.twitter.com/iv07UnIkpB
.@WalkerWorcester, Lord Bridges and I met professional services sector to discuss Brexit challenges & opportunitiespic.twitter.com/KHdQ0y7N4U
